lines.text: No matter what the shrinks, or the pundits, or the self-help books tell you, when it comes to love, it's luck.

One minute you're in the lunchroom at Glenwood High and you f***ing blink and you're 40, you blink again and you can see movies at half price on a senior citizen's pass. Ask not for whom the bell tolls, or to put it more accurately, ask not for whom the toilet flushes.
Would you sign this? I use your exercise tape.
You do?
So do I!
But I exercise to it.
Every curve in your body fulfills its promise. If the universe has any meaning, I'm looking at it.
I'm polymorphously perverse. It's not a flaw, it's just a weakness.
I've become the person I've always hated, but I'm happier.
[talking about Papadakis]
He's very arty, pretentious, one of those assholes who shoots all his films in black and white.
I can't have sex with you! My body belongs to my husband and there is no way that I could betray him in that way. But what I do from the neck up is a different story.
You're not afraid of catching germs? And you know, I'm coming down with a cold and everything...
From you I'd be willing to catch terminal cancer.
I ran into our Tony Gardello at the Cafe Carlyle. He had a blissed-out look like he had died and gone to heaven. How did you manage to put that smile on his face?
Using my head...
Did you agree with the Beatles, years ago, at the height of their fame, that they were bigger stars than Jesus?
The world population was much less then.
What's your next project?
Birth Of A Nation, an all-black version.
And you're, you're perfect. Do you have ANY flaws? I'm agog... with...
Physically?
There aren't any ticks around here, are there? I'd hate to get Lyme disease.
We haven't had any casualties.
[sighting celebrities at a screening]
Oh, and getting out of the elevator I see there's a famous critic.
Him, I recognize.
Oh, he used to hate every movie. Then, he married a young, big-bosomed woman, and now he loves every movie.
Tom Dale. *Big* star. He's in New York filming an adaptation of a sequel of a remake.
I'm sorry, the doctor just doesn't do penis enlargements. We don't have the space.
We're talking about 3 inches here!

[affecting a Southern accent]
I have always depended on the kindness of strangers...
Apparently his first two books...
self-indulgent, sophomoric, sollipsistic...
Just in time. Another minute, I'd have been found dead of comedy poisoning...
I'm awash in self-contempt!
Well, I'm working on buying St. Patrick's Cathedral, maybe doing a little rip-down job and putting up a very very tall and beautiful building.
So ironic. You go to get face work, you don't get face work, but you meet a wonderful guy, he changes your life, it's better than face work.

They're all genuine ceramic, and we got this rubber bulb here, you squeeze this, fill it with some washable red vegetable dye, give it a squeeze, you can make his wounds bleed. Watch in the back, there. Isn't that something?

[to Lee]
I hope you catch a break.

[to Al Swayze, black weatherman]
But you're cheerful, I mean you're all so cheerful.
What am I, Don Corleone?
